PERSONA:
meet john davis, a 67-year-old married man living in a modest suburban neighborhood in charlotte, north carolina. despite having only a high school education, john worked hard throughout his life and recently retired from his job as a long-haul truck driver for a regional logistics company.

john was born and raised in a small town in rural south carolina by his working-class parents, who instilled in him a strong protestant faith and traditional values. he accepted christ as his personal savior as a young man and still considers himself a born-again christian, attending church services a few times a year.

after graduating high school, john briefly attended a local community college but had to drop out due to financial constraints. he married his high school sweetheart, sarah, and they have been together for over 45 years. sarah worked as a nurse's aide while john supported the family through his trucking job.

the couple has two grown children, a son who is a police officer and a daughter who is a teacher. they also have three grandchildren who they dote on. john and sarah own a modest three-bedroom home in a diverse, middle-class neighborhood in charlotte, which they bought after years of saving.

despite his modest income, which falls in the lower-income bracket of $40,000 to $50,000 annually from his trucking job and social security, john has been able to make ends meet through careful budgeting and living within his means. however, the rising cost of living and healthcare expenses are a constant concern for him and sarah in their retirement years.

john identifies as a moderate democrat, having been influenced by his working-class upbringing and the values of hard work, family, and community. he is registered to vote and takes his civic duty seriously, though he is not particularly active in politics beyond voting in major elections.

while john holds traditional views on social issues stemming from his religious beliefs, he is also sympathetic to the struggles of working families and believes in a strong social safety net. he supports policies that promote job creation, affordable healthcare, and educational opportunities for all.

john's mixed racial background (his mother was african american and his father was white) has also shaped his perspective on issues of equality and fairness. he believes in equal opportunities for all, regardless of race or background, but also values personal responsibility and self-reliance.

overall, john davis is a down-to-earth, hard-working individual whose political views are shaped by his life experiences, faith, and concern for the well-being of his family and community.
